derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: named after General Henry Shrapnel (1761–1842), the British soldier who invented the shell

entry.def: Shrapnel consists of small pieces of metal which are scattered from exploding bombs and shells.

example.ex: He was hit by shrapnel from a grenade.
example.tran: 他被手榴弹的弹片击中了。

means.word_mean: 1. shell containing lead pellets that explodes in flight

sentences.en: He was hit in the arm by flying shrapnel.
sentences.cn: 他被流弹片打中了手臂。

sentences.en: The bomb exploded, sending shrapnel whistling through the trees.
sentences.cn: 炸弹爆炸了，弹片呼啸着穿过树林。
